title: Natasha Abrahart’s parents call for greater action and an apology from Bristol University
description: Following yesterday’s (14th February) High Court ruling to uphold the decision that Bristol University contributed towards Natasha Abrahart’s death, her parents, Maggie and Bob Abrahart, appealed for more action and an apology from the university.

title: BBC Question Time audience member skewers Labour over 'track record' of U-turns
description: A BBC Question Time audience member hit out at Labour's "track record" of U-turns in a fiery moment during tonight's show. The moment came as the panel in Lancashire debated whether Labour's biggest challenge to winning the next election is the party itself.

title: Labour will not review election candidates after Azhar Ali turmoil
description: The party has faced turmoil this week after being forced to suspend Rochdale by-election candidate Azhar Ali and their Hyndburn general election nominee Graham Jones after they made controversial comments at a private meeting of Lancashire Labour activists last year.

title: Scottish newspaper gives brutal verdict on Labour’s oil and gas plan
description: The Press & Journal, the daily regional newspaper published in Aberdeen, Aberdeenshire, Moray, Inverness, and the Highlands and Islands, slated Labour’s “betrayal” of the region, which it said would put “100,000 energy jobs” at risk.

description: A YouGov survey of more than 4,000 people revealed 19 per cent of those who previously supported the Tories would switch to the party founded by Nigel Farage.

title: Voters in Wellingborough and Kingswood take to the polling booth
description: VOTERS in Wellingborough and Kingswood headed to the polls to select their new MP today in two key by-elections. The polling closed late at night and the results were expected early this morning in the seats being defended by the Tories, with Labour expected to take both contests.

title: By-election polls updates: Rishi Sunak and Keir Starmer face a double electoral test in two previously safe Tory seats
description: RISHI Sunak and Sir Keir Starmer face a double electoral test today as voters go to the polls in two previously safe Tory seats.  The by-elections in Kingswood and Wellingborough will decide

title: Idles – ‘TANGK’ album review: An introspective exploration lacking in imagination
description: ‘Roy’: With a bassline reminiscent of The Fall’s ‘Get a Hotel’, this introspective track is among the best on the record. Talbot finds an enjoyable midpoint between his usual strained shouting and the weirdly mellow, tender vocals heard at the beginning of the album. [4/5]

title: Esther Ghey reveals her extraordinary compassion for Brianna's killer's mother as she hints 'very private, personal' meeting is on the cards
description: The brave mother of murdered teenager Brianna Ghey said this morning she would be potentially meeting with Scarlett Jenkinson's mother - but in a 'very private, personal way'.

title: Calderdale councillors back Gaza ceasefire motion
description: A motion calling for an "immediate and permanent" ceasefire in Gaza has been passed by Labour-run Calderdale Council. At a full council meeting on Wednesday, the majority of councillors supported the motion, which also called for the release and return of all hostages.

title: Sunak braced for double by-election test in Wellingborough and Kingswood
description: Rishi Sunak is braced for tests in Wellingborough and Kingswood, where Labour hopes to flip Tory majorities in the tens of thousands.

title: Brianna Ghey’s mother planning to meet parents of daughter’s killer
description: The mother of murdered teenager Brianna Ghey has said she is planning to meet the parents of her daughter’s killers. The transgender 16-year-old was brutally stabbed by Scarlett Jenkinson and Eddie Ratcliffe, both now aged 16 but who were 15 at the time, after they lured her to Culcheth Linear Park near Warrington on 11 February last year.

title: Labour bars press from secretive lobbying event at Scottish party conference
description: Exclusive: Party has refused to provide a list of sponsors and attendees at Glasgow forum for ‘high-level’ discussions

title: Labour should have acted sooner on Ali says Burnham
description: Andy Burnham has said he was "absolutely stunned" by Azhar Ali's Israel comments and Labour should have moved faster to condemn him. The Rochdale by-election candidate lost party support after his claim that Israel had "allowed" the 7 October attacks by Hamas. Greater Manchester mayor Mr Burnham said voters had been "let down".

title: OPINION - Labour's Keir Starmer is the perfect symbol for 2024: he can’t win, even when he wins
description: Sir Keir Starmer has to contend with a progressive Left who call him a traitor and a Right who claim he is an insubstantial opportunist — but he’ll still skip into the general election with a mighty 20-point lead in the polls.

title: There’s a profound shock around the corner for Keir Starmer
description: Starmer has a number of power bases to deal with, including shadow Chancellor Rachel Reeves, who has grown in confidence and authority over the past year to the extent that she gets more interest than Starmer from business figures and the sort of people in Westminster who fly like iron filings to a magnet towards the most powerful force around.

description: Ultimately, Mr Burnham said the ‘people of Rochdale’ were ‘let down’ by the party’s handling of the situation. He said: “This is not a time to make excuses, I think there has to be some serious collective reflection by the Labour Party on this.

title: What fresh antisemitism row could mean for Labour’s election chances
description: The Equality and Human Rights Commission (EHRC) issued a 130-page report in 2020 that the Labour Party broke the law three times in its handling of complaints about antisemitism while Jeremy Corbyn was party leader.

title: Scarborough councillor becomes first representative for newly registered Social Justice Party
description: The Social Justice Party has officially gained its first seat on North Yorkshire Council after registering with the electoral commission.

title: Sadiq Khan risks fuelling Keir Starmer's Gaza chaos as London mayor refuses to say whether Labour MPs should defy the leader to back SNP motion demanding immediate ceasefire
description: Sadiq Khan repeatedly refused to comment on whether Labour MPs should support a motion tabled by the SNP, calling for an immediate ceasefire.

title: Rachel Reeves Says Keir Starmer Has Not 'Let Down' UK's Jewish Community Amid Rochdale Row
description: Keir Starmer has not “let down” Britain’s Jewish community despite a row over anti-Israel comments made by two Labour candidates, Rachel Reeves has said. The party leader has faced criticism over his response to the controversy involving Azhar Ali, who was chosen to stand for the party in the upcoming Rochdale by-election.

title: UK enters recession after steeper-than-expected fall in GDP
description: The recession is likely to be mild and short lived, with no major changes in the day to day life of consumers but it's bad news for Rishi Sunak who made growing the economy a key part of the Conservative's platform.

title: Brianna Ghey's mother Esther says Online Safety Act does not go far enough
description: The mother of murdered teenager Brianna Ghey says the Online Safety Act does not go far enough to protect children. Esther Ghey told the BBC "horrible content" would still be seen by young people because she did not think it would be deemed as "harmful".

title: Only A Third Of 2019 Conservative Voters Will Back Tories At Next General Election, Says Poll
description: Only a third of voters who backed the Conservatives in 2019 will vote for the party again at the next general election, according to a new poll. On Thursday, YouGov and WPI Strategy revealed that out of 4,000 voters who supported the Tories, just 37% would support them again if an election were held tomorrow.

title: Two by-elections to test Rishi Sunak's Tories as voters head to polls
description: Rishi Sunak is braced for tests in Wellingborough and Kingswood, where Labour hopes to flip Tory majorities in the tens of thousands. Headlines this week have been dominated by a different by-election the upcoming Rochdale vote, in which Labour's candidate has had party support withdrawn over remarks he made about Israel and Jewish people.
